page.title: 11RURAL TRANSPORT
page.content: THE LACK OF PUBLIC SERVICES To live in this rural area it is almost essential to have the use of a private car. Sandhurst is a mere 5km from the centre of Gloucester yet there is only one bus a week between them, although there used to be a daily ser- vice. Even the nearest main road is over 2km from the village. West of the River Severn there is a regular bus service along the main A417 road between Gloucester and Hartpury. Residents in the Woolridge area have to walk from the main road and one or two even walk 3km to the shop in Maisemore or 2km to Hartpury. The River Severn is occasionally used by barges as far as Tewkesbury and by pleasure craft and fishermen. A small airstrip has been built at Willington Court Farm for use each year by crop spraying aircraft.
